column2: IDEA-69292 make merge possible from console

column3:
Commit makes possible to run merge tool from console.
Run format is:
/path_to_IDEA_bin/idea.sh merge /path/left.txt /path/right.txt /path/original.txt /path/result.txt
Waiting this ticket for a long time. This will be de-facto standalone merge tool. :) Especially with Git.
Have been implemented.
@klikh it does not look like this has been implemented.
Ive checked here: http://git.jetbrains.org/?p=idea/community.git;a=blob;f=platform/platform-resources-en/src/messages/DiffBundle.properties;hb=HEAD
and here: https://github.com/JetBrains/intellij-community/blob/master/platform/platform-resources-en/src/messages/DiffBundle.properties

i do not see the line
"merge.application.usage.parameters.and.description=Usage: idea merge    "
is this expected to be released in a community edition build at some point?

the following issue
http://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-69292?projectKey=IDEA&query=%23issues
implies that it has been integrated
how can i find a build with this much needed feature integrated?

@afoong
IDEA-69292 has been implemented, but we used a bit different approach than proposed by crazyproger. The functionality is available in EAP builds of IntelliJ IDEA 12 (Here is the latest EAP: http://blogs.jetbrains.com/idea/2012/09/intellij-idea-12-eap-build-122327-is-available/).
Nevertheless we appreciate this pull request made by crazyproger since it made us work on this problem and fix it.

@klikh thanks for the reply and the link! is there any documentation on how to use the merge tool from the command line? i cannot find any refernce to IDEA-69292 or "commandline" in the EAP page. Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thanks!
To use it as a merge tool invoke IDEA executable with the "merge" parameter. It will give you the basic usage information:
I've created a task to update the documentation: http://youtrack.jetbrains.com/issue/IDEA-91791
thank you !
